thread.title: Central Texas treated to rare aurora borealis sighting
thread.title_full: Central Texas treated to rare aurora borealis sighting

author: Tara Brolley
title: Central Texas treated to rare aurora borealis sighting
text:
AUSTIN, Texas â€” A geomagnetic storm brought an unexpected light show to Texas skies Thursday night, with the aurora borealis visible as far south as Central Texas.
The Space Weather Prediction Center issued a G4 (severe) geomagnetic storm alert, indicating a "major disturbance in Earth's magnetic field."
PREVIOUS COVERAGE | Central Texas catches glimpse of Northern Lights thanks to rare storm
CBS Austin meteorologist Avery Tomasco advised residents to "look to the north after dark," noting this was the second opportunity to view the northern lights in Central Texas this year.
The Leander Fire Department reported that crews at Station 1 spotted the aurora, while CBS Austin received photos of the phenomenon from viewers in Georgetown, Bastrop and Kyle.
RELATED | Texas emergency teams witness aurora borealis in North Carolina amid hurricane relief
Texas emergency responders deployed to North Carolina for hurricane relief efforts earlier this week also spotted the Northern Lights . The Texas Division of Emergency Management (TDEM) had shared on social media that their personnel witnessed the northern lights during their deployment to assist with recovery from Hurricane Helene.
